result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Michael Bohenstengel

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - Mailed 06-28-2022

3:29 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Todd Michael Bohenstengel appeared by video.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn appeared by video for Todd Michael Bohenstengel. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.  No inducement.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Scheduling conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:10 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-16-22 at 2:00 p.m.    
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eric Pangburn, is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County  Clerk of Court.

Petition for Appointment of an Attorney;  Affidavit of Indigency.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-25-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 4 counts felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he provide an address, in writing, to the Clerk of Court office within 48 hours of release and have no contact with the residence at 712 S. 23rd Street, Manitowoc, WI.    Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
